intro: Hieracium vulgatum subsp. diaphanoides, commonly known as the slender hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its slender stems and yellow composite flowers. The leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered with fine hairs, while the plant produces small, elongated flower heads. It thrives in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. This subspecies is distinguished by its delicate appearance and is often found in association with other herbaceous plants in its native range.
